ENGLISH: The nation of $FROMCOUNTRY$ has requested to have their territories returned. What will be our response?
Grant their request, they shall have their lands returned!
Deny their requests, their lands are of vital interest to our cause!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has asked if we would be intersted in seeing some of our territory returned. Now is our chance to formally request our core territories back.

On what continent is the nation you would like to restore provinces to? All eligible nations on said continent will send you an event asking for the return of their provinces. Accept this request for the nations you want to give provinces to.
The nation of $FROMCOUNTRY$ has requested to be released from their vassalage. What will be our response?
Grant their request, they shall be free once more!
Deny their request, they are of vital interest to our cause!
Our Overlord has asked all it's subjects which one among them would prefer independence. Now is our chance to ask to regain our freedom.
On what continent would you like to release a subject? All subjects on said continent will send you an event asking to be released. Accept this request for the vassals you wanted to get rid off.

Welcomes to TGC's Setup Menu! Here you have a couple of options:

§BReset All Options:§!Sets all options to the correct Default Setting, basically resetting any change you made.
§BExtra Random:§! Disables all and any Railroading and sets up Lucky Nations, aiming for the most unpredictable campaign possible.
§BSee All Options:§!Take a look at every setup option individually and hand pick whatever you want.

§BRailroading Menu§!: Open a menu with special options to control certain aspects of Railroading in the mod, stuff like forcing the ACW or the Crimea War to happen.
§BEarly Crisis§!: In TGC, crisis only start after 1862, when Revolution and Counter-revolution is researched. Enabling Early Crisis will allow then to happen at any point. 
§BUK's Splendid Isolation§!: Historically the UK did not ally major european powers, and so in TGC the UK is forced to break alliances with any Great Powers who aren't Portugal, Belgium, Japan or the Ottomans. You may wish to turn this off. 
§BUSA African Colonization§!: USA has reduced influence in Africa, as historically the USA was not interested in Africa beyond Liberia. You may wish to remove this constraint. This will not affect an USA player.

§BExtra Flavor§!: TGC has integrated some ahistorical and wacky submods allowing players (not the AI) to take their nation down implausible alternative paths. You may prefer to play without these.
§BMicrostates§!: TGC has plenty of somewhat isolated microstates, like the classic San Marino. You may wish to disable those, which makes them be annexed by bigger countries.
§BEarly Colonial Conquest§!: This will enable you (and the AI) to justify protectorates/concessions on any province anywhere except China. By default, you can justify these CBs on bordering or port countries, while inland gets unlocked by Scramble.
§BMinor Great Power Diplomancy Ban§!: Bans the 7th and 8th Great-Power from influencing nations through diplomacy (although not through the use of CB's and other ways of earning influence). For people that like a game with less nations meddling with global affairs.

§BWork Place Events§!: A few province events related to the workplace, such as 'The Old Man and the Sea', 'All the Tea in PROVINCENAME' and 'Blood and Iron Mine' can get quite spammy. You may prefer to disable those.
§BLeader System§!: There is a National Leader system which will randomly assigned prime ministers/presidents to your country, you may wish to disable this.
§BUnite as Puppet options§!: This allows a Great Power to unite some of their spherelings into a culture union puppet (Italy, Iberia, Scandinavia, Yugoslavia, Romania, Arabia, Transcaucasia, Turkestan and the United Baltic Duchy), some players consider these to be OP and prefer to play without them.
§BMobilization Limiter for the AI§!: Sets some limits on when the AI can mobilize, so it doesn't ruin it's economy mobilizing in every single small war.

§BBankruptcy Events§!: Disables annoying Bankruptcy events, in case you're not using the CBs given, find them annoying or dont want the AI to use the CBs.
§BBreak Brazil§!: This will break Brazil apart and divide it into it's states, if you're playing as Brazil you will be able to pick a state to play after the breakage is over.
§BCommie Mod:§! Enables a series of somewhat experimental and unbalanced events for Communist/Socialist countries.
§BLucky Nations:§! Bless 10 non great powers with extra luck so they are more likely to go well, this will help the game be less predictable.

Welcome to TGC's Utility menu!

§BNational Campaigns:§! Plethora of options to do do stuff like increase Research or decrease Infamy by paying high monetary costs.

§BNational Value Changes:§! Access the National Value Change menu.

§BVassal Release Menu:§! Allow you to hand pick and release vassals at will.

§BCore Return Menu§!: Allow you to return cores to other nations at will.

§BReduce Global Population:§! Will do as it says, reducing the global population by 10%. Beware as this is permanent!

§BVassal Tax Payment§!: Activate or Deactivates vassals paying tax to you.

§BRequest a General§!: This will give a single free average general. You can have only one cheat general at a time.

§BTech School Change Toggle§!: Shows decisions for Tech School Changing.
See Tech School Change options (New decisions will appear in a day)

§BBorder Control options:§! Allow you to pick a different border policy, at a cost, your options are Open Borders, Quota Immigration or Closed Borders.

§BRGO Change (Mining)§!: Allow you to change your Mining provinces into different mined goods.

§BRGO Change (Farming)§!: Allow you to change your farming provinces into different farmed goods.
Pick whatever policy you want, but be aware: You will only be able to do that again after the §RLaw Changed by Force§! modifier goes away.
Pick one of the following National Value:

§BBirth Rate Campaign:§! Give the people in your country incentives to have children and form bigger families, increasing population growth.

§BDiplomatic Campaign§!: Initiate a series of Diplomatic Actions to clear our name and make ammends with other countries, lowering our Infamy.

§BAcademic Campaign§!: By making a series of concessions to Universities and other institutions, private or public, we will able to increase our Research Point production.
Remove all currently active National Campaigns

§BColonial Settling Campaign§!: Incentivize our citizens to move and settle in our colonies, increasing colonial immigration.

§BAnti Emigration Campaign§!: By using the power of patriotism and propaganda, we will convince our citizens to stay, instead of simply using the other Utility Decision to close the borders.

§BTourism and Settlement Campaign§!: We can start an International Campaign promoting our country, and by giving incentives to new settlers, we can heavily increase the numbers of Immigrations into our country.

§BDirection Immigration Menu§!: Open The Direction Immigration submod menu. This will only work if said submod is activated.

§BAsk for Grants§!: Asks all other players for a Money Grant, they can choose to refuse it.

§BAllow players to send me Grants§!: Players will be able to send grants to you.

§BAllow players to ask me for Grants§!: Allows other players to ask you for grants, you can turn this off if they are spamming you.
Allow players to send me Grants
Allow players to ask me Grants

§BColonial Railroading§!: Within TGC there is plenty of flavor to help both the AI and the player follow a historical colonisation path in Africa and Asia. You may prefer to play without these leading to more unpredictable colonisation.
§BAmerican Civil War Bypass:§! Make so the ACW always happens. It will pretty much always happens with this option on
§BCrimea War Bypass:§! Make so the Crimea War always happens, unless conditions are REALLY against it.
§BAustria joins Crimean War:§!This option will make so Austria always joins the Crimean War, Prussia will likely join in the opposite side.
Make Austria Certain to join Crimean War (Default: §RDisabled§!)

§BBrazil will not break:§! There's a chance Brazil will break apart into multiple states, you can active this option so this will never happen no matter how bad the player or AI does.
§BFrench Revolution:§! Ensures that the French Revolution of 1848 almost always happens.
§BLouis-Napoleon's Coup d'Etat:§! If the French Revolution happens, Louis-Napoleon will almost always coup.
§BScramble for China Railroad:§! The Scramble for China will almost always happens just before they westernize, no matter how well they are doing, the scramble follows as normal afterwards.

§BEnable all songs:§! This option will enable all songs to play, ignoring all requirements. This includes cultural, non-cultural and war requirements, each requeriment can be re-adjusted later.
§BBypass non-cultural requirements:§! This option will bypass non-cultural requirements like year, being a great power, industrial score, which some songs have to play.
§BBypass warsong requirements: §!This option will make so war songs will play during peace time, the reverse is also true, as peace songs will play during war time.
§BEnable Japanese Playlist:§! This option will make so the exclusive Japanese Playlist plays for any country, mixed with the other songs enabled for this country.

It seems you don't have The Grand Orchestra submod active!

 You can download it at 
§Bhttps://github.com/The-Grand-Combination/The-Grand-Orchestra§!

§BGeneric songs enabled:§! Enables the default playlist to play to any country, this is pretty much only to asian countries who would otherwise have an exclusive playlist.

§BBrazilian songs enabled:§! Enables brazil-exclusive songs to play. Most brazilian songs are already integrated into the default playlist, so this will have little, but some, effect.

§BBolivian songs enabled:§! Enables bolivia-exclusive songs to play.

§BPeruvian songs enabled:§! Enables peru-exclusive songs to play.

§BArgentinean songs enabled:§! Enables argentina-exclusive songs to play. Most Argentinean songs are already integrated into the default playlist, but they play less often than normal if you're not Argentina.\n\n§BJapanese Playlist Only:§! The Japanese playlist is extremely well curated, you may wish to only listen to it. This will mute all other songs.
